column4: Yo, whats up with the HDMI playback for time being?? How come it doesnt 'just-work' :/
i have tried multiple approaches, none seemed to work. Only thing left for me - given my knowledge of the sound system - is to manually compile alsa
HDMI device shows fine everywhere and modules are loaded, however no audio is sent through.. aplay -D hw:hdmi_ints ..wav ?> channel count not available
k0; analog audio playback => mini-jack speakers output, digital audio playback => optical jacks etc.. hdmi => passthrough audio to receiving device
aplay -D plughw:hdmi_ints ..wav no error - yet no sound
discussions about the topic comes in multiples with many many forums
have you tried the various -ao possibilities with mplaye r?
how would i know for sure which hw:x,y is the right one?
it probabl isnt the right one for you
you'd have to research that part some more
maybe its a device listed in your /dev or whatever
that linux directory that lists all the devices on your machine
obviously you can make some guesses and try all the possibilities pretty quickly
another thing ive found with alsa if you are using that
is that alsa for me would somtimes have various outputs and inputs set to 0 volume
i think it was alsactl in a terminal that would let you control that

i was noticing some bumping 'ticks' on my TV over hdmi once i turn up volume 50% + (very loud). Reinstalled fglrx with one shipped on ubuntu repositories and now its gone (thumbing). yet still no audio
MonkeyDust thx but sadly none of the above forum threads is the solution
